content:
IssuedSecurityTokenProvider Class

In this Article

Represents a token provider for issued security tokens.

Syntax

Declaration

public class IssuedSecurityTokenProvider : System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider, System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider
  • IssuedSecurityTokenProvider

Inherited Members

BeginCancelToken(TimeSpan,SecurityToken,AsyncCallback,Object)
,
BeginCancelTokenCore(TimeSpan,SecurityToken,AsyncCallback,Object)
,

,
BeginRenewToken(TimeSpan,SecurityToken,AsyncCallback,Object)
,
BeginRenewTokenCore(TimeSpan,SecurityToken,AsyncCallback,Object)
,

,
CancelTokenCore(TimeSpan,SecurityToken)
,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

Remarks

Care must be taken when caching and reusing security tokens that are returned from the GetTokenCore method, because the security token might become unusable when the channel that the token provider is associated with is closed. The security token becomes unusable when the requested key type is asymmetric and the thread is running under impersonated context when the GetTokenCore method is called.

Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenProvider class.

Constructors

  • IssuedSecurityTokenProvider()

    Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenProvider class.

    public IssuedSecurityTokenProvider ();

Properties

  • CacheIssuedTokens

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the issued tokens are cached.

    public bool CacheIssuedTokens { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the issued tokens are cached; otherwise, false.

  • DefaultCloseTimeout

    Gets the default time-out for closing the connection.

    public virtual TimeSpan DefaultCloseTimeout { get; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the default time-out for closing the connection.

    Remarks

    For internal use only.

  • DefaultOpenTimeout

    Gets the default time-out for opening the connection.

    public virtual TimeSpan DefaultOpenTimeout { get; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the default time-out for opening the connection.

    Remarks

    For internal use only.

  • IdentityVerifier

    Gets or sets the identity verifier.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.IdentityVerifier IdentityVerifier { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • IdentityVerifier

      The identity verifier.

  • IssuedTokenRenewalThresholdPercentage

    Gets or sets the issued token renewal threshold percentage.

    public int IssuedTokenRenewalThresholdPercentage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The issued token renewal threshold percentage.

    Remarks

    This percentage controls how often the token provider contacts the SecurityTokenService for a new issued token. For example, if the percentage is 90 percent, then the token provider will contact the SecurityTokenService when 90 percent of the issued token's validity interval is over.

  • IssuerAddress

    Gets or sets the issuer address.

    public System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress IssuerAddress { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • EndpointAddress

      The issuer address.

  • IssuerBinding

    Gets or sets the issuer binding.

    public System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding IssuerBinding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Binding

      The issuer binding.

  • IssuerChannelBehaviors

    Gets the issuer channel behaviors.

    public System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection<System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> IssuerChannelBehaviors { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyedByTypeCollection<IEndpointBehavior>

      A stem.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1 that contains the behaviors for the issuer channel.

    Remarks

    These channel behaviors are added to the channel used by the token provider for the SecurityTokenService. The key for this collection is the URL of the security token service.

  • KeyEntropyMode

    Gets or sets the key entropy mode.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityKeyEntropyMode KeyEntropyMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityKeyEntropyMode

      The key entropy mode.

    Remarks

    This property is the key entropy mode used by the token provider when negotiating a symmetric key with the SecurityTokenService to use with the issued token.

  • MaxIssuedTokenCachingTime

    Gets or sets the maximum time that an issued token will be cached.

    public TimeSpan MaxIssuedTokenCachingTime { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the maximum time that an issued token will be cached.

  • MessageSecurityVersion

    Gets or sets the message security version.

    public System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion MessageSecurityVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • MessageSecurityVersion

      The message security version.

    Remarks

    The MessageSecurityVersion contains numerous properties that specify version numbers of different components of a message.

  • SecurityAlgorithmSuite

    Gets or sets the security algorithm suite.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite SecurityAlgorithmSuite { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityAlgorithmSuite

      The security algorithm suite.

    Remarks

    The SecurityAlgorithmSuite object that is returned contains numerous properties that specify security algorithms to use in specific conditions. It also describes various security capabilities of the service.

  • SecurityTokenSerializer

    Gets or sets the security token serializer.

    public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer SecurityTokenSerializer { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenSerializer

      The security token serializer.

  • State

    Gets the communication state.

    public System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState State { get; }

    Property Value

    • CommunicationState

      The communication state.

  • SupportsTokenCancellation

    Gets a value that indicates whether token cancellation is supported.

    public override bool SupportsTokenCancellation { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if token cancellation is supported; otherwise, false.

  • TargetAddress

    Gets or sets the target address.

    public System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress TargetAddress { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • EndpointAddress

      The target address.

  • TokenRequestParameters

    Gets the token request parameters.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Xml.XmlElement> TokenRequestParameters { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<XmlElement>

      A collection of XML elements that represent the token request parameters.

    Remarks

    This is a collection of XML elements that the token provider includes as part of the RequestSecurityToken it sends to the SecurityTokenService. These parameters can be set explicitly by the client or can be obtained from the relying party's security policy.

    Parameters

      TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan after which the call times out.

      AsyncCallback

  • Close()

    Closes the provider.

    public void Close ();

    Closes the provider.

    public void Close (TimeSpan timeout);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan after which the call times out.

  • Dispose()

    Releases all resources used by the current instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenProvider class.

    public void Dispose ();
  • EndClose(IAsyncResult)

    Ends the asynchronous call for closing the provider.

    public void EndClose (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      An IAsyncResult object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.

  • EndGetTokenCore(IAsyncResult)

    Ends the asynchronous call for getting the token core.

    protected override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken EndGetTokenCore (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      An IAsyncResult object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      A security token.

  • EndOpen(IAsyncResult)

    Ends the asynchronous call for opening the provider.

    public void EndOpen (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      An IAsyncResult object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.

  • GetTokenCore(TimeSpan)

    Gets the token core.

    protected override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken GetTokenCore (TimeSpan timeout);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan after which the call times out.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      The SecurityToken that represents the token core.

    Remarks

    Care must be taken when caching and reusing security tokens that are returned from the GetTokenCore method, because the security token might become unusable when the channel that the token provider is associated with is closed. The security token becomes unusable when the requested key type is asymmetric and the thread is running under impersonated context when the GetTokenCore method is called.

    public void Open ();

    public void Open (TimeSpan timeout);

  • Opening
